sponsor: The George Washington University Biostatistics Center
briefTitle: Tranexamic Acid for the Prevention of Obstetrical Hemorrhage After Cesarean
officialTitle: Tranexamic Acid for the Prevention of Obstetrical Hemorrhage After Cesarean Delivery: A Randomized Controlled Trial
summary: A randomized placebo-controlled trial of 11,000 women to assess whether tranexamic acid as prophylaxis lowers the risk of postpartum hemorrhage in women undergoing a cesarean delivery.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Maternal Death or Transfusion of Packed Red Blood Cells
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: by hospital discharge or by 7 days postpartum, whichever is sooner
